intro: Hieracium caesiogenum, commonly known as the blue hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright blue or purple flower heads composed of numerous small florets, with pale yellow central disc florets. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it often grows in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium caesiogenum is an annual or biennial plant that thrives in temperate climates.
